citations.narrative:
On May 18, 2023 a woman entered the ring tail lemur enclosure for an interactive encounter. A 2 year old male Lemur,
identified as Biggie , immediately left his station position and jumped on the woman's shoulder biting her on the side of
the face and scratching her lip. The woman sought medical treatment for her injuries. The facility was unable to assure
the safety of both the public and the animal during this interactive encounter. During public exhibition, the animal must be
handled so there is minimal risk of harm to the animal and to the public with sufficient distance and /or barriers between
the animal and the viewing public to assure the safety of the animals and the public.
This inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the husbandry manager .
n

narrative:
2.131(c)(1)  Critical Repeat
   
Handling of animals. 
On May 18, 2023 a woman entered the ring tail lemur enclosure for an interactive encounter. A 2 year old male Lemur, 
identified as Biggie , immediately left his station position and jumped on the woman's  shoulder biting her on the side of 
the face and scratching her lip. The woman sought medical treatment for her injuries. The facility was unable to assure 
the safety of both the public and the animal during this interactive encounter. During public exhibition, the animal must be 
handled so there is minimal risk of harm to the animal and to the public with sufficient distance and /or barriers between 
the animal and the viewing public to assure the safety of the animals and the public. 
 
This inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the husbandry manager . 
 
 n
